page.title: 09CLEANSING DEPOT: SHEFFIELD
page.content: Bernard Road is one of Sheffield's largest depots. Trucks for collecting refuse and cleaning streets are garaged and maintained there. Opened in 1975, there is an incineration plant which handles about half of all the refuse collected in{Sheffield. Heat obtained from the incinerator provides heating and hot water for 2,500 dwellings on the{Hyde Park estate. This means burning 10 tonnes of refuse every hour. The{Cleansing Department}collect domestic refuse rfrom dustbins and make 'special collections' of large items such as old furniture and scrapped cars. Commercial refuse is collected separately and there is also a skip hire service. Streets and public toilets are cleaned regularly. The Liason Section organises visits and talks for interested groups.
